alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:29PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Laramie and south central Platte Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 629 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles west of Chugwater, or 24 miles south of Wheatland, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Laramie and south central Platte Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 41 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; South Laramie Range Foothills
